ImageSource.SourceImageOrganizer Class Reference

The SourceImageOrganizer is used to add, remove and modify images in the ImageSource program. This class maintains a list of all SourceImage objects, and calls the SourceImageFactory as necessary to change the values of the reference file. This is a singleton class, and must be accessed using the getInstance() method. More...

Detailed Description

The SourceImageOrganizer is used to add, remove and modify images in the ImageSource program. This class maintains a list of all SourceImage objects, and calls the SourceImageFactory as necessary to change the values of the reference file. This is a singleton class, and must be accessed using the getInstance() method.

This class is used to gain the functionality of the SourceImageFactory class.

Member Function Documentation

void ImageSource.SourceImageOrganizer.addImage ( string  imageName,
string  path 
)

Creates a SourceImage based on the provided information, and adds it to the system. The SourceImageFactory is then called to add the SourceImage object to the reference file.

If the image already exists, the image is not added to the system a second time.

Parameters:
imageNameThe full file name of the image to be added, including file extension.
pathThe full path to the image to be added, including file name and file extension.
ArrayList ImageSource.SourceImageOrganizer.getImageList (  )

This is used to obtain a list of all image objects loaded into the system.

Returns:
Returns an ArrayList created from a <![CDATA[KeyValuePair<string name, SourceImage image>]]> object, where "name" is the file name of the image, and "image" is the SourceImage object.
Dictionary<string, SourceImage> ImageSource.SourceImageOrganizer.getImageMap (  )

A function used to get a list of all SourceImage objects.

See also:
SourceImageOrganizer.getImageList()
Returns:
static SourceImageOrganizer ImageSource.SourceImageOrganizer.getInstance (  ) [static]

Returns the single instance of the SourceImageOrganizer in the running program. Example: 

            //get the instance
            SourceImageOrganizer imageOrganizer = SourceImageOrganizer.getInstance();.

//the same organizer object can now be used to access the images from //any class which has retrieved an instance.

Returns:
The current SourceImageOrganizer instance.
void ImageSource.SourceImageOrganizer.removeImage ( string  imageName )

Removes the specified image from the system, and then calls SourceImageFactory to remove the image from the reference file.

Parameters:
imageNameThe file name, including file extension, to be removed.
